conclusion: Analyze the motion of the small ball in each segment of the track using energy and momentum conservation.
Calculate the length of the inclined track AB using trigonometry: AB = h/sin(37°) = h/0.6.
Determine the final velocity at the bottom of the track B using work done by gravity and friction: v_B^2 = 2gh(1 - μ * 1/0.6).
Use conservation of momentum and energy during the elastic collision at track BC.
Apply conservation of momentum: mv_B = mv_1 + mv_2, leading to v_1 + v_2 = v_B.
Apply conservation of kinetic energy: v_1^2 + v_2^2 = v_B^2.
Solve equations simultaneously: v_1 = v_B or v_1 = 0, resulting in v_1 = v_B.
Determine the velocity at point F where the ball moves horizontally to point Q.
Calculate the horizontal distance x_max using time taken to fall from F to Q: x = v_F * t.
Determine the maximum horizontal distance x_max between landing point Q and point F is 0.79 m.
